name: ListServiceEventRules
description:
Retrieve list of event rules for a specific service.

Use this tool to obtain the event rules associated with a specific service on Pagerduty. Note that this feature will soon be deprecated, and it is recommended to migrate to Event Orchestration for enhanced functionality. This tool requires 'services.read' permission via scoped OAuth.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service whose event rules are to be listed.

parameters.name: response_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API response using the Accept header for version control in requests.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request. Set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page. Specify an integer value.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination in the search results. Useful for iterating over results in batches.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_additional_models
parameters.description: Specify additional models to include in the response, such as 'migrated_metadata'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the 'total' field in pagination responses. This may affect response time.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
